strings:
<se_low>Yangus: This place is in the middle o' nowhere!
Must be either a cranky old man or a bandit wot lives 'ere, I reckon. One or the other!

<se_def>Angelo: The only ‘people’ living here are monsters.
What a strange place.
<se_high>Jessica: So the owner of this place has monsters as house guests!? Now I've seen everything!
<se_low>Yangus: I'd never live wiv monsters! I'd be too scared they'd attack me in the middle o' the night!
<se_high>Jessica: I cannot fathom wanting to live in the same house as a monster!
<se_def>Angelo: I wonder if that's why this house is in such a remote place, so that monsters can live in it too?
<se_low>Yangus: I really doubt we'll find Jessica 'ere.
<se_low>Yangus: Maybe we should try somewhere else, eh?

<se_def>Angelo: It's partly thanks to the old man here that we managed to defeat Dhoulmagus.
We should probably say a few words of thanks.
<se_def>Angelo: But we need to concentrate on finding Jessica first.
<se_low>Yangus: So the old man's still livin' out 'ere wiv 'is monsters! D'ya reckon 'e ever gets scared?
<se_high>Jessica: Thanks to the old man who lived here, we were able to work out how to use the sun mirror against Dhoulmagus.
<se_def>Angelo: Even I can see why he'd want to keep a slime and a dracky. They're actually quite cute in their own way, I suppose.

<se_def>Angelo: But a mud mannequin!?
Now that I can't even begin to understand!
<se_low>Yangus: I didn't really get wot the old geezer was on about.
<se_low>Yangus: But you understood 'im, eh, guv? You know 'ow to sort out that sun mirror now, right?

<se_low>Yangus: Nice one, guv!
Let's go an' do wot's gotta be done then!
<se_low>Yangus: If you don't get it, there's no way I will, guv.
<se_low>Yangus: I s'pose we'd better talk to 'im again and make sure we know wot we've gotta do, eh?
<se_high>Jessica: All we have to do is recharge its magic power, and the sun mirror will be ready to go!

<se_high>Jessica: Sounds easy enough!
What are we waiting for?
<se_def>Angelo: Ah, well, that's a relief!
<se_def>Angelo: I was starting to think we wouldn't be able to use the magic mirror. And after all the pains we went to getting hold of it!
<se_low>Yangus: So the old man's still livin' out 'ere wiv 'is monsters! D'ya reckon 'e ever gets scared?
<se_high>Jessica: We really owe the man who lives here a debt of gratitude. We never would've worked out how to reactivate the sun mirror without him!
<se_def>Angelo: Apparently there are other monsters out there like the ones here, who don't feel the need to attack humans.
<se_def>Angelo: So maybe the old man's right not to worry about his housemates having him for dinner one night. I hope so, anyway...

<se_low>Yangus: The monsters 'ere are still pretty quiet, eh?
I thought they might've gone a bit bonkers now Rhapthorne's causin' such a fuss.
<se_low>Yangus: I s'pose they're too attached to the old man to 'urt 'im now, though. Bit like cats an' dogs.
<se_high>Jessica: The old man who lives here certainly seems to know his stuff. I mean, he knew all about the sun mirror, curses and, well, everything!
<se_high>Jessica: Maybe he can give us some tips on Rhapthorne, too!
<se_high>Jessica: ...Or am I expecting too much?
<se_def>Angelo: Ever since Rhapthorne was resurrected, monsters all over the world have been getting more and more aggressive.
<se_def>Angelo: I'm a bit worried that the ones here might end up turning on the old man.
<se_low>Yangus: I s'pose it's possible. We could've turned up today an' found just a skeleton, eh!?
<se_high>Jessica: I don't think monsters would leave anything behind, though. Not even a single bone.
<se_low>Yangus: Urgh!

<se_def>Angelo: You're so soft sometimes, <hero>.
Come to check on the old man living on his own, have you!?
<se_def>Angelo: I suppose he did help us out a lot in the past.
<se_def>Angelo: It's nice that you never forget your debts of gratitude to people. I like that about you.

<se_high>Red: Well, I've seen it all now!
Takes all sorts, eh?
<se_high>Red: Mind you, as long as they do wot they're told, I'd take this bunch o' monsters over my lazy lot any day.
<se_low>Morrie: To find someone living with the monsters in a place like this... Incredibile!

<se_low>Morrie: I wish I can invite him to come to my pit,
but he does not like to fight, ay?

<se_high>Red: I could never take in monsters like 'e 'as 'ere.
Even to 'elp 'em out.
<se_high>Red: I mean, you'd just 'ave to turn ya back for a second, and WHAM! They'd do you in, right? And make off wiv all yer stuff. This bloke must 'ave nerves o' steel, that's for sure.
<se_low>Morrie: The Rhapthorne is trying to break the bonds of friendship between the monsters and the humans...
<se_low>Morrie: AAARGH! As the owner of the Monster Arena this is one thing I can not forgive! NEVER!
